intro: Lastrea subattenuata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lastrea, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in full sun. Its leaves are linear and slightly fleshy, and it produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
